intro: Sebastiania serrulata var. hispida, commonly known as the rough-seeded sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured seeds. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and yellowish flowers. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its attractive foliage and unique seed structure.
